items.title: Family offices strengthen Indian capitalism
items.description: Family offices in India are reshaping industries by investing in innovation, supporting startups, and strengthening the economy. They ensure domestic capital stays within India, guiding entrepreneurs towards sustainable growth while contributing to long-term economic value

items.title: Coca-Cola to sell bottling plant in North Gujarat to Kandhari Global Beverages for Rs 2,000 crore
items.description: In the December quarter, Coca-Cola divested a 40 per cent stake in HCCBL to the Bhartia family.

items.title: India can emerge as global hub for AI given its tech prowess: Nadir Godrej
items.description: Godrej further said that India’s vision of 'Viksit Bharat’ by 2047 will be fuelled by progressive reforms, ease of doing business, empowerment through education, and the country’s edge in new-age technologies.

items.title: Maximising asset value through IBBI regulations
items.description: The IBBI plays a pivotal role in maximising asset value under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code. New regulations aim to improve efficiency, reduce delays, and ensure transparency in the resolution process, though challenges like prolonged timelines persist

items.title: IKS Health: Can this stock restore your portfolio’s health?
items.description: IKS Health is an opportunity to participate in the US healthcare outsourcing market that is growing at a steady pace and is still relatively under-penetrated

items.title: LTTS: Poised for growth despite automobile sector slowdown
items.description: The company reaffirmed its medium-term outlook of $2 billion revenues with an EBIT margin of 17-18 percent

items.title: Aadhar Housing: Growth story continues with steady asset quality
items.description: The company delivered healthy quarterly earnings and is poised to leverage sectoral tailwinds
